column4: anybody know of a free app similar to cpu-z/cpuid for windows for linux?
/proc/ has all sorts of neat files with system info in them
cat just prints a text file to the shell...
In theory you could make some ap that just shows the output of /proc/cpuinfo it  a special file that appears  to be a read only text file.
theres other neat info files in /proc also.
go there and look. :) be carefull wha tothe rfiles you 'cat' from /proc/ theres one or 2 files that are like all the systemememory. that can  print gibberish to the screen
cat /proc/cmdline  -> shows what options the kernel was booted with..  each process has a diretory in /proc/ google for /proc/ theres bound to be a lot of neat guides that detail the stuff
vmcore is one i dont think ya want to cat.  but a user cant do that anyway. :)
the command line is the heart of linux. :)
with that logic we would all still be using DOS.... :P
I was into CP/M :) back then.. heh..
heh  -  an early OS, ran on Z80 cpu's
not needed it for years. I tend to collect emulators of old pc/systems. I got a Timex Sinclare hanging on the wall, a vic20 and C64 in the garrage  and some amigas laying about.
for a laugh check out http://goosh.org/
yea its fun to play with.
